Reviews.Title: “it was just ok”
Reviews.Author: argostoli1289
Reviews.Content: good location near Termini Station,not very helpful staff especially the night receptionist. It was an average hotel, good prices

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Mourantie N
Reviews.Content: I have been with my husband in Rome on January 2012.. On 27-31/1/12... Brasile was a good city hotel... It wasn't the hotel that you can stay a whole day in... We just used it for shower and sleeping... But ok... You are in Rome,so you will sped the whole day outside walking around sightseeing and shopping.... And eating pasta and pizza of course!!!! :)) so,it is a good choice if you do not want to spend a lot of money for your accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellicko
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The rooms are surprisingly comfortable and the location is great despite the proxomity to the Termini station. All in All, Highly recommended for 3 stars hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: mrosex3
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with my boyfriend for our anniversary. We are studying abroad in Spain and on a tight college student budget, but splurged a tiny bit because of the occasion. I was a bit worried after reading the reviews on here, but we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Brasile. We bought a Rome map at termini station to find the hotel and use during our stay, but once we easily found the hotel they have maps provided. We checked in quickly and the receptionist was very nice and funny. That night we were tired and asked for a dinner recommendation, unfortunately the restaurant they suggested was slightly disappointing, oh well. Breakfast was nice, I loved the chocolate cereal they had. The one pitfall was the level of street noise, but this was my 3rd hotel staying in Italy and all 3 had loud street noise, so I wasn't too surprised. I called down to the front desk for some extra pillows, and he said it would be better if I came down and got them, which was fine with me. Level of cleanliness was fine for us, beds were comfortable, no big problems. For around 100 euro a night in an ideal location near Termini, definitely a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: 2oldetravellers
Reviews.Content: This is the third time in five years that we have stayed at this hotel. It's proximity to Termini Station originally attracted us but the friendly and accommodating staff, reasonable prices and cleanliness compelled us to return. On this occasion our room was showing signs of repair and the vents were very dirty, raising a concern about air quality. The staff is still great and the prices reasonable for Rome but some maintenance is needed for the rooms. The generous breakfast is a nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price but nothing special. A very tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: NiinaE
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Rome almost a week. The hotel was very basic, the room was so small and tiny!!!! But it didn´t bother us since we enjoy walking and go only to sleep in the hotel. The hotel was a walking distance from the main railway station Termini. Rome was a little disappointment. When we first got there the taxi driver was overcharging us so we didn´t use cabs but only this one time... Not a good start for a holiday. The food was ok and I definitely want to go back someday with my kids for the sights but then I´ll be staying in an other hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaoireDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights a week ago - it is very basic - just a step up from a hostel. The rooms are very small and the bathroom has seen better days. While the hotel is very close to the train station you need to know where you are going to find it - in hind sight I would have asked for a different hotel - I wouldn't recommend it - there is much better value to be found it Rome

Reviews.Title: “Expected better.”
Reviews.Author: m_aelag
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Brasile for only one night. We were rather disappointed with the hotel....to be fair, we didn't really have the time to experience the hotel, and its location, though good, is quite a walking distance from Piazza Barberini, or Stazione Termini. Upon arrival, we were informed that there was some overbooking problem, and that, since we were only booked for one night, they would put us up in an apartment. We followed the guy at reception through a run down yard that displayed open garages filled with stores and old stuff....really very shoddy! We were then given the key to a large glass door. Inside, we found ourselves in a large, rather modern duplex. To be fair, it was clean, but seemed unfinished. We had a choice between two bedrooms, two bathrooms...so all in all, we decided to accept this offer, even if it was rather eerie to stay in this duplex all alone.....walking through that yard in the middle of the night made my wife very uncomfortable. The duplex was air conditioned, and we had a large flat screen t.v.so we couldn't really complain. Breakfast was a continental buffet, with ham, cheese, bread and croissants. Considering the price, we feel we could have got a better deal, even if hotels in Rome are really terribly expensive!

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid if travelling on business”
Reviews.Author: stanopoulos
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a business trip to Rome and chose it as it was close to the railway station. In fact it looks nothing like the pictures on the web and some of the facilities it advertises are misleading. The rooms are tiny - just enough space to walk around the bed. Rooms are dark and gloomy, carpets and walls grimy. The air conditioning was not strong enough to cool down the room in the midst of 34C summer heat. The bathroom was laughably small with no bathmat and a cracked shower tray. A small portable TV for entertainment and wifi only down in the lobby. Definitely not suitable for the business traveller. Did I mention that an erotic cinema is behind the hotel? And no food either!

Reviews.Title: “terrible to be honest”
Reviews.Author: natalie2288
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thinking the reviews were a bit harsh and decided to give it a go and I have to say it was not for my boyfriend and I. I have to say the morning/afternoon clerk was extremely nice and helpful and the breakfast was decent (you had a wide range of meats, rolls and typical continental breakfast). The location was OK it was a bit of a walk to and from the main attractions maybe 20mins (mainly up and down hill) but we did not mind. It is about 15mins from Termini station which was handy. Unfortunatly the bad overides the good when it comes to this hotel: It was old and tacky. The room, you could not swing a cat in, the Air con (not that it worked) kept me awake every night because it was loud and rattled. The shower is ancient, the walls have carpet material on, the bed spread made me itch and when I got home this afternoon I had bites all over my body. The TV- to be honest I did not see the point in there being a TV because it small and it was like watching TV back in the 90s with the fuzzy reception. The garden/smoking area needs a darn good revamp and it was like sitting in some tacky bar in Benidorm. The night clerk I thought was rude and made me feel unwelcome. I asked for a bottled water and he simply looked distressed at the fact he had to get off his chair. Last night he was carrying water bottles and my boyfriend opened the door for him and he just grumbled at him; not even making the effort to say gratzie or thank you. He was scruffy looking and he stared a lot at us which made me feel uncomfortable. Yes the hotel is budget but for £100 a night you expect a decent shower, TV and polite staff (only night staff in this case). Overall there were good points to this hotel as I have mentioned but for me I just think it needs a complete revamp both staff and decor.

Reviews.Title: “good value,would recommend”
Reviews.Author: JODEAL
Reviews.Content: having read mixed reviews about this hotel before i travelled i was not sure what to expect, myself and my partner travelled with our 18 year old daughter and had booked a triple room for 6 nights, when we arrived we were shown to a triple room which was quite small, i spoke to reception who within 10 minutes had given me the key to a larger room, which suited our purposes. the hotel is very well situated for visiting most of the sights in rome, we walked pretty much everywhere with the exception of the visit to the vatican as this was on the far side of the tiber and time was an issue on that particular day. the hotel building itself is old as are most of the buildings in rome therefore you have to make certain allowances, the staff were very pleasant and helpful and the rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day, while i do not eat breakfast myself, my partner and daughter found the buffet breakfast adequate, bearing in mind that the hotel does not have a restaurant breakfast consists of cold cuts , cheese,yoghurt,breads and croissants. all in all this hotel was very good value for money, yes there are large modern hotels around rome with more facilites but they lack the character of the hotel brasile and surrounding area and i suspect you would find yourself spending a great deal of time travelling to the sights which are as i said are within walking distance of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel Within 30mins Walk to Most of the Sights”
Reviews.Author: finchyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Brasile for 3 nights at the end of april 2011. I paid around £90 BB for a room, per night. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk north of termini station, we got the Terravision bus transfer from Ciampino airport to termini (8 euro return) then walked to the hotel. Check-in was quick and the gentleman on reception spoke good English. The hotel is located opposite an embassy and the 1st floor room we were given had a small balcony which overlooked the embassy gardens on the road side. Unfortunately the hotel is located on a busy corner and there was quite a bit of loud continuous road noise during the day, but little between 11pm-7am. The room and en suite were on the small side but they were both clean and I found the bed firm but comfortable. Breakfast is basic continental fare: cereal, yoghurt, toast, ham, cheese and croissants. It was fine. There is a metro station about 5-10 minute walk from the hotel but we walked to most of the tourist sites. The Vatican is about a 30 minute walk from the hotel. The metro is good value at 1euro per trip or 4euro for a day pass. I'd stay at the Brasile Hotel again as long as it was one of the cheaper alternatives. *Rome now has a tourist tax, this is 2 euro per night per person and must be paid on check out in cash. *Restaurants near the tourists traps are hideously expensive you can half the cost of a meal by simply walk a few hundred metres away from the crowds. Also watch out for the "cover charge" that restaurants and cafe's apply to the bill, some charge it directly others make you pay for the bread they serve at the start of a meal - it's around 10%. If you aren't going to eat the bread send it back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value 3 star hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: pjay00
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic 5 day visit to Rome. Very pleased with the hotel despite previous reviews. Found the reception staff very pleasant and helpful. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was fairly spacious with a fridge containing very reasonably priced drinks. The bed was large and comfortable. There was plenty of hot water in the shower and the towels were changed every day. The continental breakfast was plentiful and continuously replenished. The fresh croissants were lovely. There is a small reasonably priced bar in reception serving coffee and drinks and a lounge with easy chairs. We used the safety deposit box at 1.50€ per day. The hotel is opposite the British Embassy about a 30 minute stroll to the Colosseum. We walked everywhere but there is a bus stop outside the hotel and the main train station is only a 10 minute walk away. The metro and bus stations are also here. The free map at reception came in very handy. There are several restaurants close to the hotel and all those we tried were of a good standard and reasonably priced. All in all a very pleasant trip and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: rhondamckane
Reviews.Content: Damp on walls, stains on lampshades, smell of sewage coming up through drains in bathroom - need i say more. Photos totally misrepresent the true state of the hotel. Complained to staff and were offered another room which was no different - had to leave and get another hotel before it ruined our trip. Take heed to this review and others who had a similar experience.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!! DAMP, SMELLY AND RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Jackie4712
Reviews.Content: I always thought that people who leave bad reviews were just hard to please and I have never left a review before but trust me, don't book this hotel. It is nothing like it's description. The room had mould on the wall, the bathroom was musty and smelt of sewage and the breakfast was pitiful! When I complained to the receptionist he showed me what he said was a better room but it was almost identical. I explained that we would have to move somewhere else and he then became rude and unhelpful and refused to refund our payment. There is a far better hotel close by called the Marcella Royal, for a little bit extra a far superior hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: fowlerclan
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a budget based, central location, clean rooms and a nice breakfast. The hotel is in a fairly good location to walk to most of the sights. The staff are friendly, but the hotel is not in a good state. The rooms are extreamly small and are very smelly of smoke. The carpets are really grubby and dirty with stains. The bed linen was dirty and the blankets, i did not want even near my skin. There is no wallpaper, its material, and i think this may be absorbing the smells. The shower cubical was cracked and still had pubic hair from the last people. The bathrooms are incrediably small and you cannot sit even sit on the toilet without the shower being in the way. The mini bar, if thats what you call it had two bottles of water, one of which had been opened by a previous occupier and filled with water from the tap and put back in the mini bar. The lift is quirky, like an old fashioned film, and we laughed about it. the breakfast was the most dissapointing, its just cereal, cold meats and cheeses, bread roll, and dry packets of crispy french toast. There were of course fruit juices and tea and coffee. Its not enough choice for different pallets. Even a toaster and bread would have been better, so we went hungary. The hotel is very old and tired looking, and its a shame because this could be a really lovely hotel, centrally based. We knew it was budget, but the quality is below budget, and i would definatly not stay here again. We only wanted a base to sleep, were not spending time there, just sleep and breakfast and back out again. Shame, but it did not spoil my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brasile: Budget Hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: travelcityguy
Reviews.Content: While the staff of the hotel are fabulous and are helpful, the rooms, showers, etc are budget at best. Rome is some place that is hit or miss--at least in my experience. I would not return to this hotel based on our stay. The room smelled of smoke, the shower was cold and I was very unimpressed with the hotel in general. The bed was the worst that I slept in my entire time in Europe. The breakfast was of poor quality and going down the street was of significant superior quality with coffee and a pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Brasile”
Reviews.Author: AAF254
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go for a holiday in Rome for our second wedding anniversary. We booked our accomodation at Hotel Brasile through their website. They were really helpful and they even booked transport from airport to the hotel for us. The rooms were very tidy .. the maids were very very nice. We had no problems what's so ever. i would like to thank all the staff working there for the unique experience we had during our stay in Rome :))

Reviews.Title: “Very good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankKehler
Reviews.Content: I've spend recently a 5 days holiday in Rome with my wife and we've choosen Hotel Brasile because of the central location just in front of the British embassy and the vicinity to the public transport and subway station which is at 5 minutes walking distance. The historical centre attractions like Via Veneto, Spanish steps etc are at 15-20 minutes walking distance. The hotel is a very nice 3 stars and all services worked properly. We had a nice quiet room on the third floor facing the internal courtyard and everything was perfect. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and all towels etc were changed every day. We went for dinner in a small restaurant next to the hotel twice and there's plenty of nice and cosy places in that area where you can have lunch or dinner. For excursions around the city you can catch the metro at the Termini station or do as we did ask the hotel staff that was very helpful to organise a day-trip to Naples for us. Overall we had a great holiday and Rome is always worth a visit. I would definetely recommend Hotel Brasile, it has been great value for money for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money !!”
Reviews.Author: Pancho_50
Reviews.Content: Staff were very pleasant and helpfull, in fact they went out of their way to be helpfull. The room was clean and comfortable. Good sized bed. Towels etc. changed every day. Toilet was on the small side so don't take a cat!!! The hotel was located quite close to the "Termini" and close to a number of nice restaurants and cafe's. It was a bit noisy with traffic but not too bad. It was about a 15-20min walk into the centre but Taxi's etc are all available locally. Breakfast was good with a selection of fruit, cereals, rolls, pastries, yogurts, fruit juice, coffee and tea which set's you up for the day. All in all a pleasant 4 night stay. Would I go back ------- yes!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service, very rude employees!!”
Reviews.Author: Anach18
Reviews.Content: We got in the hotel, the person on the reception was very rude, they gave us a room on the first floor, it looked ok but when we were going to sleep the sheets had hairs!!!! Disgusting, them the bathroom is so small and it smells really bad! Don't go there, u can find better for the same price

Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexM5
Reviews.Content: it was a very nice stay for 3 stars, break fast was amazing, it even had a lift, 5 minute walk from the underground station nd a short ride to the main station, over all a brilliant cheap hotel

Reviews.Title: “BE CARFULL, it's not safe for your money and documents.”
Reviews.Author: cuteitaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just one night, the room was clean bath room was small, but OK Our room was in the 1st floor in front of information desk, Next morning when we were out of room -but inside the Hotel- for breakfast my father in low' money and Green card which was inside his carryon vanished. We find out quickly after leaving the Hotel, but interesting part was cooperative of the maids and receptionist. they not only were not helpful but also when I was searching the room they screaming and emphasizing that we lost it outside the hotel, and if I don’t stop asking question about who was entered the room while we were in the other room for breakfast, they said they will call police to get rid of us and they just backed off when they realized I already trying to reach the police. DONT FORGET OUR ROOM WAS INFRONT OF INFORMATION DESK.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: leslie012
Reviews.Content: We had to remove all the blankets and covers on the bed because they were crusted with dirt, thank god the sheets seemed to be clean. The shower had a build up of dirt and hair in it that who knows how long it had been since it had been cleaned. It was horribley dark and dingy, could hardly see in the rooms the lighing was so poor. We slept on sheets that seemed to be cleaned and did not touch another thing in the room and left as soon as we could in the morning. I don't know where they got those pictures on the web site from but the rooms were dark, old, dingy and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good better than expected after reading reviews online”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandPamela
Reviews.Content: was not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. clean and well situated for any siteseeing. Ours was a triple room with three single beds in one room and was spacious with a fold down bed settee in a separate room and exactly as shown in the hotel photos. There was also a small courtyard/terrace at the back of the hotel which was nice to sit out in.I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Service, Location”
Reviews.Author: DonNewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Brasile for eight nights in December 2008 and we would stay there again. You can take the train from the airport and have a ten minute walk or short taxi from the Termini to the hotel. For excursions around the city, you can catch the metro at the Termini or at the Piazza della Republica, which is a little closer. The hotel staff was very helpful. They gave us a room on the street side but, because reviews said that could be noisy, we asked for a court side room. They had only one available, and it was smaller than the first room, but they said we could have our choice. We took court side. After five nights we headed for a week in Florence. The hotel stored our extra suitcases at no charge. Upon our return the suitcases were waiting for us in our room, which this time was a relatively large one on the court side. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. Yes, the showers are small, though the one in our second room was larger than the one in the first. The towels are not plush, but they are large and replaced with clean ones every day. The breakfast was fine and pretty much what we expected (breads, cheese, ham, cereal, etc.). The one problem was no hot water one late morning. As a bonus there is a great restaurant on the next corner, Salsamenteria Verdiana. They make their own cured meats and will serve a variety of them on a platter. The restaurant has an opera theme, and often has live music (e.g., three singers and a piano doing Verdi).

Reviews.Title: “Last chance saloon”
Reviews.Author: HenryV111
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute family get together booking. What a bad choice. The lowest of the low. Stayed here for 3 nights for our mums 80th birthday. Everything negative that has been said about this 'hotel' is true... the showers are tiny, the towels are so thin I think they are disposable, the breakfast is uugh what the orange juice is made from I dont know but its not oranges. Rooms are tiny, dirty and dusty and you get the remote for the 14" TV only after you leave your passport at reception. Don't be fooled by the flat screen TV on their website its not in the bedrooms its in a reception room downstairs. The stairs and lift reminded me of a scene from a gangster movie set in a New York slum. Best of all its not even cheap at 100 euros a night. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “had a memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: evtravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: two of us stayed at this hotel end of september 2008 for three nights it was a last minute decision to visit rome to end our european holiday we found this hotel to be in a very safe area as the streets are always patrolled by security gaurds being close by government embasseys. The hotel is in a good location close to buses the metro and termini staion is a short walk you can also walk leisurly to some main attractions and piazzas. our room was on the second floor it was clean and the beds were comfortable. we had a room that faced the main road but noise was not a problem as the room appeared to be sound proofed . the breakfast served was good and tasty help yourself system we have funny happy memories from this hotel the shower cubicle is very small too bad if you drop the soap and need to bend down you have to get out of the shower to pick up the soap if you can manage to squeeze through the door the towels are not the normal white thin linnen looks more like a table cloth and teal towel but they did the job as for the lift a bit ancient looked a bit dodgy we preferred to use the stairs but the lift added to the character of the building the best of all is the reception staff very very very friendly go the extra mile to help you and make you feel welcome when I return to rome one day I would stay here again but I would book it direct through the internet you get a better deal I think we paid too much through a travel agent being last minute all said and done if you want to stay all day in a hotel room with the comforts of home then stay home this hotel is not for you but if you want a safe pleasant stay I reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 643amc
Reviews.Content: Location :- 10 minutes walk from Termini Station Main Door on Via Palestro across the street from the British Embassy and close to other embassies. My experience . Booked on line in a hurry and had no choice as most hotels in the area were full. Asked for a double room . Got two single beds pushed together to make a double. My wife found this very upsetting as she prefers to sleep close to the centre of the bed and she kept ending up on the edge of the mattress which was a bit worn out .It did not help her backpain . Pillows were flat by my standard and only two per room. The lift is very small , like many hotels in Rome, and only holds 2 persons in comfort. The firts floor is not served by the lift . The first room which I stayed in , was one of the smallest double I have ever seen. Just enough room to stand tightly around a double bed.The same can be said about the bathroom, so small that I had to go out of it to dry myself with the towel.Towels are paper thin and only two a day are provided. Not enough if a couple take two showers a day. Talked to the reception and was immediately offered and accepted a very nice room on the first floor which was twice the size of the first , with a reasonably sized bathroom. Only used the room to sleep, as spent most time out . Good points : - 1) Receptionists, are older gentlemem who offer good advice and help to all enquiries. 2)Buffet breakfast served at 0700 till 1000 was fair and service was clean. 3)Hotel area is safe , due to patrols by Embassy Security across the road. 4)Well served by the buses just round the corner , which take you to the Vatican and all the Piazzas . 5)Reasonable priced 130 euros for a double . 6) Rooms clean and recently refurbished with double glazed windows and air conditioned . All this was taken in stride , and the Hotel served its purpose,as a base for a short weekend in Rome centre. Unlikely but , If and IF I ever book again, I would ensure that I get a large room, not a squeezed room, and get better towels . I wrote this , to help anyone , but mostly the Management of the hotel, who could fix most of these small problems and make the Brasile a true 3 star Hotel , from the 2 Star which I would rate it , due to these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: ZoeBan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very tight, the narrow hallway, the miniscule lift and small room and bathroom. The room felt old and dingy, and if we opened the window in the bathroom a weird smell came in. Our room faced the back. The towels were exactly like dinner napkins, or tablecloth. You could hear people in the bathroom next door. The immediate area seemed seedy and abandoned, but perhaps only because we arrived after dark. We had to leave at 6am the next morning so we didn't get to check out the breakfast. The evening concierge was a nice older man, who offered to make us espressos in the morning before we left, but we didn't have time in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean”
Reviews.Author: Globe_trotter093
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-night stay in Rome. Hotel Brasile was clean and beatifully furnished but the room was very small. One could hardly manage to use the shower! The towels were replaced daily with clean ones but they were thin like tissue paper. Breakfast consisted of one type of ham and cheese, coffee / tea/ juices, 3 types of cereals, pastries, and preserved fruit. Breakfast can surely be improved! Location is 10 minutes from Termini Station very close to Porta Pia. Staff were always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “some reserve”
Reviews.Author: sportboy
Reviews.Content: nice hotel,clean room,but very noisy,if you happen to have no other choice to stay there make sure you have a room on the court yard side, it is very noisy on the street. breakfast very ordinnary.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review of Hotel Brasile”
Reviews.Author: jls7255
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small by my standard. I am used to 5-star Asian hotels. The bathroom shower is terrible small. My elbows kept of hitting the sides. The bath towels are as thin as baby diapers - first time to experience. But they change it everyday. We had a small balcony which maybe is good for smokers. I do not smoke. Only a few rooms have a balcony and the view is facing the rear end of the hotel. Not much of a view. In front of the hotel is the Bristish Embassy. Good for security since there is always a police car around the corner in front of the embassy. Bad-they removed the bus stop fronting the hotel(for security?). Good - it is about a 15 minute walk to the Rome central train station. Breakfast is ok and people is the restaurant are friendly. Bad - some of the reception staff are not friendly. Possibly because I am Asian. Bad-elevator is very small. Only 1 and can only fit 3 to 4 medium size persons.

Reviews.Title: “Brasile Hotel - Home to the smallest bathroom in the world”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBSheffield
Reviews.Content: I have just come back after an excellent long weekend in Rome. Luckily Rome has an awful lot to offer tourists or we would have spent more time in the hotel and when the hotel you are staying in is the Hotel Brasile, that is a problem. The room was distinctly average with a very small bathroom - so small it was one step away from the old style toilet in your shower scenario, however the main problems were the unclean smell from the toilet that greeted us on our arrival and the most unhelpful staff on reception. The smell I can get over however, arrogant, aloof, rude, ignorant and unhelpful are just a few (polite) words I would choose to describe the hotel staff - Overall, the most simplest things (mainly information / directions) was so much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurotripper07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brasile in February 2007 for our 30th wedding anniversary on the recommendation of our travel agent and were very satisfied with the hotel. The room was a bit on the small side, but this wasn't a problem as we spent all day out in the city. The hotel was only a 1 and 1/4 hour walk from the vatican (which was the opposite end of the city), taking in the spanish steps or the trevi fountain so we found we didn't need to take buses or trains at all and everywhere was within walking distance. The room was very clean and the towels changed every day. The shower is a bit small but the pressure was very good. Having stayed in 3 star hotels in other european big cities, it compared very well. The only criticisms are that the drains smelt (but that I suspect wasn't the hotel's fault) and there was only one thin pillow each. The staff were great and very helpful, including sort out a day trip to pompei where we were picked up and dropped off at the hotel. I would use them again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel, good price no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: majiq
Reviews.Content: After reading the terrible review of the Brasile Hotel we were worried about what we should expect. However we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms were neat clean and serviced daily. I'd happily stay at the Brasile Hotel. For a nice functional hotel in Rome it does well. Matt

Reviews.Title: “Shambles of epic proportions”
Reviews.Author: Tomdel
Reviews.Content: How anyone (unless they live in a hole) could even deem this a hotel I have no idea. A general overview first. Staff where very unhelpful, location is terrible, rooms are tiny and badly laid out. We had to stay one night here before our travel agent found us another hotel, it was a long night. We dropped our bags off at the room which promted me immediatly to return to the front desk and ask for a nicer room. The suprise on the guys face was amazing - apparently we had the nicest room! In fact we had a prison cell with a large bed in it. In fact I don't even think the bed was large it was an optical illussion given the size of the room and bathroom. The room was indeed a very strange shape, it seemed to have 1/3 missing it wasn't until our next door neighbour decided to take his 4 a.m. toilet run that I realised that the 1/3 missing was the toilet from next doors room jutting into ours! It's quite distressing to hear another persons toilet habits echoing around your room at 4 a.m. Last straw... We checked out rapidly, they seemed very upset with us and very unhelpful in our plight to escape the madness. We spent an additional £ 400 for 2 more nights in another centrally located 4 star hotel in Rome, but I would have gladly paid £ 4,000 to escape the Brasile Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Brasile”
Reviews.Author: Trav3lbound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotele Brasile for a little less than a week in a room with one queen bed. The location was great, everything was clean, the staff was courteous and helpful, and I even missed the nice continental breakfast a week later when I was home in the states. The hotel itself is located in a pretty nice part of town. I think there were some embassies or foreign residences in the neighborhood, as there were cameras and armed guards a few blocks down -interesting to walk past on the way home from a cozy trattoria with a stomach full of penne arabiatta. The hotel was also located within walking distance of several subway stops (and plenty of cozy restaurants), and in fact we walked there from the subway stop from the airport. The cab we asked the concierge to arrange for us for an early morning flight also turned out perfectly. The window of our room looked out to a sort of courtyard, with a pleasant enough view. We were not on the ground floor, so there was no noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked after reading numerous reviews of numerous hotels on TripAdvisor. It was much better than expected, with great service from reception - in particular, Salvo - who were always willing to answer questions, provide transportation advice, and ask how your day was. We stayed in two single rooms as they didn't have enough twins but this was fine - rooms were small but clean and tidy. Per other reviews, the bathrooms were tiny but not a problem as, most importantly, they were clean. Breakfast wasn't anything to write home about but served us well enough for the start of the day. Location wasn't great, at the top of the completely uninspirational Via XX Settembre (we ended up trying to find alternative routes everyday to get back) and a bit far at the end of the day when you're all walked out and just want to get back...but not completely unreasonable. The nearest sights are the Quirnale and Trevi fountain which are about a 15 minute walk, but we walked everywhere anyway. The walk to the Vatican City, which is right over on the opposite site of Rome, took about an hour. There is also a Metro station close by (Castro Pretorio). All in all we found the hotel comfortable and friendly and worked very well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Alright but probably can do better”
Reviews.Author: DallasTricia
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very affordable but not the most attractive. Considering this trip was planned sort of spur of the moment, we can't really complain. The bathroom was pretty clean. The building seemed to house two separate hotel operations and the up-to-date pictures on the website did not represent what you actually get. I think those pics are from another hotel or something. The walk from the train station wasn't bad and the area seemed safe enough, but definitely off the beaten path. Overall, it served our needs, but we definitely would have preferred staying closer to the action of the Spanish Steps or one of the other plazas like Piazza Navona or near the Vatican. If your budget allows, spend a few extra euro from some place nicer if that's important to you. My sister recently stayed at the Hilton C. and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable experience at Brasile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Brasile with our small child. The hotel delivered on our requests for a cot and a room with a bath for which we were grateful, as well as a quiet courtyard room. The room was furnished well, albeit a little dusty in the corners, and our interactions with staff pleasant but perfunctory. A major drawback was the poor coffee and juice for breakfast in a fairly impersonal breakfast room. The hotel could also improve its shared lobby to enhance its overall appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Mendes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much better than expected. Very small but clean room, with nice view to the back. Brekbast was ok and the staff nice. Quiet place, a bit far from the main streets, but safe.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our toilet seat was also taken by housekeeping and not repaired or replaced during the remainder of our stay. Very clean hotel in a nice quiet area, but not people friendly or accomdating -- even when issues are brought to the front desk. Still a nice place, but not one I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: svraisondetre
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in March 2004. We didn't know what to expect when we booked a room at the Brasile as we couldn't find much about it on-line. We took a taxi from the Termini (no meter turned on) and he charged us 20E!! Our first impression on viewing the hotel lobby was favorable. Salvo, at the reception desk, greeted us warmly. We were fortunate with the choice of rooms as our's was on the 2nd floor facing the interior courtyard. It was larger than we expected for a room in a European capitol. I fell in love with the Brasile when I saw the bathroom. It had a bathtub! And a bidet. Later we would discover that the tiled floor was heated. The room was renovated nicely. The bed was comfortable, it had a well stocked minibar (there is also a bar next to the reception desk), and we were able to get on-line in the room. The towels were bath blankets and plush, tho one day they were thin and holey. The cold breakfast was adequate. The location was in a good neighborhood with the British embassy across the street and excellent restaurants close by. The metros were a short stroll away. We walked to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. At the end of the day the hotel's small but working elevator was a blessing. The staff was friendly and helpful, always with a greeting. Tho no safe in-room, a lock box was available downstairs. We were very happy with our stay at the Brasile Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better....”
Reviews.Author: ESQTeam
Reviews.Content: We were dissappointed with this hotel. The location is relatively near the Termini Station and we would recommend anyone to get a taxi to and from the Termini Station. The hotel is right at the corner of possibly a major intersection. Buses, motorcycles and cars are screeching all around the corner. One may perhaps want to get an inner room as opposed to one facing the street. The breakfast was decent. There could have been more variety and the pastries could have been softer. The Orange Juice appeared to be from concentrate. Our toilet seat was broken by housekeeping and they didn't seem to care to fix it. We discovered this after getting back from tourist trips and there was nothing they could do when we brought this to the front desk's attention. The bathroom shower was about three feet by three feet. I do complement the hotel on the beds. Very firm and nice to sleep in. Also, the room could have used a safe. There was not one in our room.
